<<<<<<< HEAD
The soldiers catechisme, composed for the King's Armie; wherein his 1 cause is justified, and his enemies condemned. 2 Soldier is instructed, and the rebell reclaimed. Written for the incouragement and direction of all that have taken up armes in this cause of God, his Church, and his annointed; especially the common soldiers. By T.S. Swadlin, Thomas, 1600-1670.
[6], 15, [3] p.
Printed by Henry Hall, Oxford : 1645.
Dedication signed: T. Svvadlin. Written in response to: Ram, Robert. The souldiers catechisme: composed for the Parliaments Army. The words "1 cause is justified, .. reclaimed." are bracketed together on title page. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Running title reads: The souldiers catechisme. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July 9th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The soldiers catechisme, composed for the King's Armie; wherein his 1 cause is justified, and his enemies condemned. 2 Soldier is instructed, and the rebell reclaimed. Written for the incouragement and direction of all that have taken up armes in this cause of God, his Church, and his annointed; especially the common soldiers. By T.S. Swadlin, Thomas, 1600-1670.
[6], 15, [3] p.
Printed by Henry Hall, Oxford : 1645.
Dedication signed: T. Svvadlin. Written in response to: Ram, Robert. The souldiers catechisme: composed for the Parliaments Army. The words "1 cause is justified, .. reclaimed." are bracketed together on title page. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Running title reads: The souldiers catechisme. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July 9th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Henry Hall
